topics.body:
*ALRIGHT, I DID IT!!!
I have finally watched all of Attack on Titan (so far), and boy, THAT was certainly a blast, and I've had a great time watching it!*

Still going to watch out for future spoilers to come, and I certainly can't wait for the next season to air sometime next year in 2016. 

Also, to my fellow fans of Attack on Titan, I'm glad I can see the show for all its worth, and I thank you for being supportive of me while I was watching it. Even to those who don't like the show, I thank you for being tolerant enough to not haze me for liking it.

Attack on Titan hasn't become my favorite show of all time, but it's definitely one of the most impressive-looking anime I've seen in a long while. It's not perfect, and it's pretty harsh and dark, but my god does it feel so epic to sit back and watch it for its majesty. Then again, this is me talking about Attack on Titan.
 
*As for a certain surprise after the credits:*
[spoiler]!http://images.latintimes.com/sites/latintimes.com/files/styles/large/public/2014/07/11/attack-titan-season-2.jpg?itok=M2rqIj4m!
[/spoiler]
*~[spoiler]That won't end well for sure...
Nothing can end well from a scenario like that.[/spoiler]~*
topics.author: 536f7a11636872666e2d0000

I did say I was going to avoid future spoilers from the manga until Attack on Titan's Season 2 starts to air, so don't expect me to follow it all that much.

Because I want to be surprised.
Even if I might come off as being silly or stupid being surprised.

topics.body:
Meanwhile, Guren no Yumiya is such an epic theme, and worthy of being THE main theme song for Attack on Titan. In fact, that intro is probably one of the key motivators for me to even get into it, and a lot of other people as well. That, and the hilarious parodies of the intro are always fun to watch.

So why did it get swapped out for something that comes off as utterly pathetic in comparison?
Seriously, the new theme is terrible compared to the old theme.

I hate the new theme.
